(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مجموعة وسط دين معيّن؟

ExampleWords.AUni: sect, denomination, party,

Question.AUni: (4) What are the names of the sects?
(4) ما هي أسماء الطوائف؟

ExampleWords.AUni: Catholic, Protestant, Baptist, Presbyterian, Methodist

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to a group of believers in a particular place?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مجموعة من المؤمنين في مكان معيّن؟

ExampleWords.AUni: church, congregation, diocese, parish

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to beginning to believe in a religion or changing from one religion to another?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني بداية الإيمان بدين أو الانتقال من دين إلى آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: convert, conversion

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to religious practitioners--people who practice a religion, who are members of the religion, believe in the religion, leaders of the religion, and followers of the religion. Each religion has its own terms for religious practitioners. List these terms separately for each religion. The examples given below are for the Christian religion.

Question.AUni: (1) What is a person called who believes in a religion?
(1) ماذا نسمي شخصا يؤمن بدين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: believer, member (of the faith), adherent, follower, practitioner

Question.AUni: (2) What is a person called who believes in the (Christian) religion?
(2) ماذا نسمي شخصا يؤمن بالديانة المسيحية؟

ExampleWords.AUni: Christian, brother, fellow believer, saint

Question.AUni: (3) What is a leader of the (Christian-Protestant) religion called?
(3) ماذا نسمي قائد الديانة المسيحية عند البروتستنت؟

ExampleWords.AUni: pastor, minister, parson

Question.AUni: (4) What is a leader of the (Christian-Catholic) religion called?
(4) ماذا نسمي قائد الديانة المسيحية عند الكاثوليك؟

ExampleWords.AUni: priest, father, bishop, archbishop, Cardinal, pope, man of the cloth

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to the profession of being a religious leader?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني المهنة التي يكون فيها الشخص قائدا دينيا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: pastorate, priesthood, ministry

Question.AUni: (6) What words refers to all religious leaders?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني كل القيادات الدينية؟

ExampleWords.AUni: clergy

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to followers of a religion who are not leaders?
(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني التابعين لديانة بدون أن يكونوا قادة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: laity, layperson, flock

(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شخصا يؤمن بالإحيائية؟

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to a religious object.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to idols and their use.

(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني ممارسة صناعة أو عبادة الأوثان؟

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to places of worship. Each religion has different types of places of worship. These questions must be answered according to the practices of each religion and for each separate type of place.

(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مكانا مخصصا للّه؟

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to thinking and acting against God or religion.

Question.AUni: (1) What is a person called who does not believe in a religion?
(1) ماذا نسمي شخصا لا يؤمن بِدين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: unbeliever, pagan, gentile, heathen, atheist, agnostic, irreligious, godless

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a religious group, which the official religion considers to be false?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مجموعة دينية تعتبرها الديانة الرسمية خاطئة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: false religion, sect

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to a belief, which the official religion considers to be false?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني عقيدة تعتبرها الديانة الرسمية خاطئة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: heresy, heretical, heretic, false doctrine/teaching

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to thinking against God?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني التفكير ضدّ الله؟

ExampleWords.AUni: disbelieve, unbelief, lack of faith, doubt, skepticism, agnosticism, atheism, paganism

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to speaking against God?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني التكلّم ضدّ الله؟

ExampleWords.AUni: blaspheme, scoff, profane, irreverent

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to acting against God?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني العمل ضدّ الله؟

ExampleWords.AUni: sin, impiety, ungodly, godlessness, desecrate, sacrilege

Question.AUni: (7) What words describe someone who is against God?
(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شخصا يكون ضدّ الله؟

ExampleWords.AUni: impious, irreligious, profane

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to turning away from God?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to prepared food. Cultures vary widely in the number and types of foods they prepare, and in how they classify them. For instance the English distinction between main dish and side dish is not found in the classification system of other languages. If your language has well-recognized subcategories, you can set up a separate subdomain for each. The questions below are based on the main ingredient in the dish.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to being naked--not wearing any clothes, and for words referring to how a person feels about being naked. It is a part of universal human experience that people do not want to be naked. So there are words that refer to feeling bad if one does not have enough clothes on (shame). Other words refer to wanting to have enough clothes (modest). Other words refer to how people feel about other people who do not wear enough clothes (indecent).

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to being naked?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أن يكون الشخص عاريا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be naked, nakedness, nude, nudity, unclothed, nothing on, not have anything on, stripped, bare, expose (oneself)

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to not wearing enough clothes?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني عدم لباس ما يكفي من الملابس لستر الجسد؟

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to not wanting to be naked?

ExampleWords.AUni: modest, propriety, decent

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words that refer to fire and for words referring to types of fire. These words may be specific for what is being burned (forest fire 'a fire burning a forest'), the size of the fire (inferno 'a very large hot fire'), or the place where the fire burns (hellfire 'the fire in hell').

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to a fire?
(1) ما هي الكلمات العامة التي تعني نارا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: fire, combustion,

Question.AUni: (2) What types of fire are there?
(2) ما هي أنواع النيران الموجودة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: fireball, torch, firebrand, fireworks, firecracker, burn a field before planting,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to what is being burned?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الشيء الذي وقع حرقه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: house fire, forest fire, grass fire, wood fire, oil fire

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the size of the fire?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني حجم النار؟

ExampleWords.AUni: spark, flame, flicker, finger, tongue, flare, blaze, conflagration, inferno, raging inferno

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to where the fire is?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني المكان الذي توجد فيه النار؟

ExampleWords.AUni: campfire, hellfire

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to a fire started by accident?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني نارا قد اشتعلت بفعل حادث؟

ExampleWords.AUni: blaze, the flames,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to a fire started on purpose?
(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني نارا اشتعلت لهدف ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: cook fire, bonfire, controlled fire,

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to deliberately burning something?
(8) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني حرق شيء بطريقة مُتعمَّدة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: burn something, set something on fire, set fire to, torch (v),

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to the crime of burning someone's house or field?
(9) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني جريمة حرق منزل أو حقل شخص ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: arson, arsonist

Question.AUni: (10) What words describe something that burns easily?
(10) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا يحترق بسهولة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: flammable, inflammable, combustible

Question.AUni: (11) What words describe something that will not burn?
(11) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا لن يحترق؟

ExampleWords.AUni: fireproof, unburnable, fire-resistant, unquenchable

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words indicating the posture or stance of a person's body. Use the domains in this section for specific words for postures and for moving parts of the body. Many of these words have two meanings. One meaning is stative, indicating that the body is in a particular posture, but not moving. The other meaning is active, indicating that the person is moving his body into a particular posture. Some of these words can be used of animals or even things, if the things are perceived as being similar in posture to that of a human body.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to bowing to someone--to face someone and lower your head or bend at the waist so that your upper body is lowered. The words in this domain should all be symbolic acts, that is, the culture assigns a meaning and significance to the physical action. Some cultures define it as a greeting, as an act of respect, or as an act of submission. For instance in ancient middle eastern culture bowing was an act of submission done in the presence of the king. Failure to bow was an act of rebellion punishable by death. In far eastern culture it is a greeting. In African culture it is an act of respect or done to welcome a visitor. Cultures define how a person is to bow, for instance how they are to hold their hands. A person may bow while standing, or may kneel, or even prostrate himself flat on his face. Whether both people bow is also significant. The depth of the bow can have significance. In Japan the person of lower social rank must bow deeper. In European culture a performer bows to acknowledge applause.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to bowing?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الانحناء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: bow, bow down, bow to/before someone

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe how a person bows?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف كيفية انحناء شخص؟

ExampleWords.AUni: sweeping bow, bow low, deep bow, slight bow, bow your head, his head fell, incline your head, nod, curtsy, genuflect, kowtow, prostrate, grovel

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate the significance of the bow?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز مغزى الانحناءة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: obeisance, worship, bow in submission/reverence/greeting

AStr.Run: Use this domain for intransitive verbs of movement referring to moving your whole body to a different location. There are many components of meaning involved in verbs of movement. They can include a source location (from), a goal location (to), a path (along), manner (walk, run), speed (race, crawl), direction (forward, back, side, up, down, toward, away from), shape of the path (straight, curve, circle, angle), relationship to some object or objects (on, hang, against, between, across, through, into, out of, onto, off of, around), proximity (near, far), multiple movements (back and forth, return, bounce), inclusion with other objects or parts of objects (join, leave, collect, disperse, unite, separate), volition (go versus drift), intransitive versus transitive (move versus move something). Some verbs of movement do not involve moving from one place to another, but express bodily movement.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to moving your body to a different location?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني تحريك جسدك إلى موقع آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: move, movement, change position, maneuver, jockey for position, budge

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to beginning to move?

ExampleWords.AUni: stir, make a move

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to something falling--for something to move down under the influence of gravity.

ExampleWords.AUni: sink slowly, float down, drift down, settle,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving toward, in the direction of, or near something or some place. The words in this domain should refer to moving in the direction of a place, but should not require that the person actually arrived. Some languages (such as German and Polish) distinguish 'go on foot' from 'go in a vehicle'.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to moving toward a place?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني التحرّك نحو مكان؟

ExampleWords.AUni: move toward, go toward, head toward, go in the (general) direction of

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to moving near something?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني التحرك و الاقتراب من شيء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: approach, move near, come near, move in on

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to two things moving toward each other?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئين يتحركان باتجاه بعضهما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: converge, be on a collision course

AStr.Run: They didn't know it, but their paths were converging.; The two ships were on a collision course.

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the place toward which a person is moving?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني المكان الذي يتّجه نحوه شخص ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: destination, goal

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving away from a place.

ExampleWords.AUni: move from/away/away from, go away, get away, retreat, back off, run away, come from

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving away from the speaker. In Australian languages many movement words are marked for direction toward or away from the speaker.

AStr.Run: Go away!; Leave me alone!; Get out of my sight!

Question.AUni: (2) What do people say when they want someone to come?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to organizing things, people, events, and ideas--to think about and decide on the pattern a group of things should be arranged in, and then doing whatever is necessary to arrange them so that they can be used for some purpose. This domain is like the domain 'Arrange' except that 'Arrange' emphasizes physically moving the things, and the domain 'Organize' emphasizes the logical system. 'Organize' does not require that the things be moved, only that the logical pattern is specified.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to organizing things?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني تنظيم أشياء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: organize, dispose, structure, get together, get it together, get your act together, chart, marshal, put in a chart, put in a table, put in a matrix, sort, sort out, systematize, tabulate,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the pattern in which things are organized?

Question.AUni: (3) What tools and methods are used for organizing things?

ExampleWords.AUni: table, matrix, chart, organizational chart, flow chart, grid, cubby hole, pigeon hole, in basket, out basket,

(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أشياء تتحرّك في نفس الاتجاه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: move together, move parallel

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to more than one thing moving away from each other?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أشياء تتحرّك مبتعدة عن بعضها؟

ExampleWords.AUni: disperse, thin out, melt away, break up, spread out, diverge, permeate,

(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أشياء تتحرّك في اتّجاه بعضها البعض؟

ExampleWords.AUni: gather, collect, form, mass, congregate, converge, close (v), close in on, concentrate, crowd in,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to more than one thing meeting?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أشياء تلتقي مع بعضها؟

ExampleWords.AUni: meet, come together, unite, crash, collide,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to the place where things come together?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني المكان الذي تجتمع فيه الأشياء مع بعضها؟

ExampleWords.AUni: meeting point, focal point, focus, confluence

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to more than one thing moving around in a place?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أشياء تدور حول مكان ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: crowd, fill, mill around, swarm,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to being simple or complicated--words describing the organization of a group of things.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to hitting something.

ExampleWords.AUni: box, beat up, punch, hit out at, strike out at

(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني ضرب شيء ما بقبضك أو بيدك؟

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to aiming at a target, and for hitting or missing the target.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to kicking--to hit something with your foot. The words in this domain may be distinguished by the way in which the foot moves, either in a swinging motion, or by first bending the leg and then quickly straightening it. They may also be distinguished by whether the foot moves horizontally or vertically, whether the effect is to move something or damage it, or how hard the person kicks.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to kicking something?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني ركل شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: kick, give something a kick, kick in (a door), boot, punt, stamp, stomp on, stub your toe on something

ExampleWords.AUni: harmful, toxic, toxicity, unwholesome, dangerous,

Question.AUni: (10) What words refer to something that has been damaged?
(10) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا ما قد وقع اتلافه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: breakages, damaged goods,

(11) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما قد وقع اتلافه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: spoiled, broken, busted, messed up, damaged, crumbling, moth-eaten,

(12) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما يمكن أن يُتلف بسهولة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: vulnerable,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to destroying something--to damage something so that it is beyond repair and cannot be used.

(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا يقع تحطيمه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: destruction, ruin,

(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شخصا أو شيئا يحطّم الأشياء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: destroyer,

(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شخصا أو شيئا يحطّم الأشياء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: destructive,

(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا قد وقع تحطيمه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: ruin, wreck, wreckage, shipwreck,

(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما قد وقع تحطيمه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: destroyed, ruined, wrecked, be in ruins,

ExampleWords.AUni: repair, fix, mend, restore, restoration, undo, correct, rebuild, right, put to rights

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words refer to the state or condition of something.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to the state or condition of something?
(1) ما هي الكلمات العامّة التي تعني حالة أو وضعيّة شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: state, condition, shape, position,

(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز الحالة التي يكون فيها شيء ما؟

Use this domain for general words referring to the amount or quantity of something.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the amount of something?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني كمّيّة شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: amount, quantity, level, volume, percentage, proportion, sum, how much, ($100) worth,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the amount of something that can be counted?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني كميّة شيء ما يمكن أن يكون معدودا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: number, how many, numbers, ratio,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to the amount of food that someone is given?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني كميّة الطعام التي تُمنح لشخص ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: portion, helping, serving, intake, ration, measure,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to a measured amount of something?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني كميّة من شيء ما يمكن قيسها؟

ExampleWords.AUni: quota, load,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to the amount of something, such as fuel, that is available to be used?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني كميّة من شيء ما (مثل الوقود) كون متوفّرة للاستهلاك؟

ExampleWords.AUni: pool, stock, reserves,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the amount of medicine that a sick person needs?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني كميّة الأدوية التي يحتاجها شخص مريض؟

ExampleWords.AUni: dose, dosage,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to the amount of a problem such as crime or damage?
(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني حجم مشكل مثل الجريمة أو الضّرر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: extent, incidence, level, rate,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to numbers. Every language has a word for 'one', and a word for 'two'. These two numbers often have special words. So we have included a separate domain for 'one' and 'two'. In addition the numbers form a series (one, two, three...). Most languages have more than one series of numbers (first, second, third...). So we have also included a domain for each series of numbers that most languages have. Your language may have other series of numbers. Put them in the domain 'Number series'.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a written number?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني عددا مكتوبا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: number, figure, digit, numeral,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a number of people or things?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني عددا من الناس أو الأشياء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: toll, statistics,

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe different kinds of numbers?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف أنواعا مختلفة من الأعداد؟

ExampleWords.AUni: even, odd, positive, negative, infinite, cardinal, ordinal, whole, fraction, decimal,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to writing numbers on a series of things?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني كتابة الأعداد على سلسلة من الأشياء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: number (v), numbered,

Question.AUni: (5) What words indicate that there are a particular number of something?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أنه يوجد عدد معيّن من شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: number (v),

AStr.Run: The group <numbered> fifty.
Use this domain for words related to the cardinal numbers (one, two, three)--the numbers used to count.

Question.AUni: (1) What are the cardinal numbers? (the numbers you use when you count)
(1) ما هي الأعداد ألأصلية (الأعداد التي تستعملها حين تحسب) \qun (2) ضعاف العشرة

ExampleWords.AUni: zero, one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten, eleven, twelve, thirteen...

Question.AUni: (2) multiples of ten
(2) ضعاف المائة

ExampleWords.AUni: ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, sixty, seventy, eighty, ninety

Question.AUni: (3) multiples of one hundred
(3) ضعاف الألف

ExampleWords.AUni: one hundred, two hundred

Question.AUni: (4) multiples of one thousand
(4) عداد أكبر من ألف

ExampleWords.AUni: one thousand, two thousand

Question.AUni: (5) numbers larger than one thousand
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل لتشير إلى الأعداد التي تنتمي إلى فئة عشريّة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: million, billion, trillion, quadrillion

Question.AUni: (6) What words are used to refer to the numbers of a certain decimal place?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل لتشير إلى مجموعات تنتمي إلى فئة عشريّة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: the digits, the tens, hundreds, thousands, millions, billions, trillions

Question.AUni: (7) What words are used to refer to groups of a certain decimal place?
(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني عدد كبير جدّا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: tens, hundreds, thousands, tens of thousands, millions, billions, trillions

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to a very large number?
(8) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني عددا غير محدود؟

ExampleWords.AUni: huge number, myriad, zillion, jillion, umpteen, googolplex,

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to an unlimited number?

ExampleWords.AUni: infinity, infinite, boundless, endless, limitless,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the number one. It appears that every language has a word for 'one' and 'two', but not every language has a word for the numbers higher than two. Many languages have several words that mean 'one'.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to one?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني رقم واحد؟

ExampleWords.AUni: one, first, individual, single, only, the one, one apiece, one each,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to being by yourself?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أن تكون بمفردك؟

ExampleWords.AUni: alone, by yourself, sole,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to doing something by yourself?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني فعل شيء بمفردك؟

ExampleWords.AUni: alone, on your own, solo, solely,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to people doing something one by one?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أناسا يفعلون أشياء مرتّبتا واحدة تِلو الأخرى؟

ExampleWords.AUni: one by one, singly, individually,

Question.AUni: (5) What words indicate that something happens or is done one time?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تُشير إلى شيء يحدث أو يُفعل مرّة واحدة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: once, one time, single time, one-off,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the number two.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to two?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني اثنين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: two, second, two times, two-fold, double (v), twins, brace, dichotomy, deuce, dual, dyad, twain, yoke, in pairs, in twos, two by two, by twos, two at a time, two apiece, two each, both, either, neither,

(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شخصين يفعلان أشياء مع بعضهما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: couple, pair, duo, twosome, duet,

(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئين يُستعملان معا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: pair, twin,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to something used by two people?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا يُستعمل من قبل شخصين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: for two, double, two-man,

(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا متركّبا من جزأين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: double (adj), couplet, duplex,

(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا يُستعمل من أجل شيئين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: dual, twofold,

Question.AUni: (7) What words indicate that something is two times the amount of something else?
(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أنّ شيئا تساوي مرّتين كميّة شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: twice, double, twice as much (as), two times as much (as), two times what, double what,

Question.AUni: (8) What words indicate that something happens or is done two times?
(8) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا يحدث أو يُفعل مرّتين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: twice, twice over, two-time,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the ordinal numbers (first, second, third)--the numbers used to indicate the order of something in a series, such as "the first child".

Question.AUni: (1) What are the ordinal numbers?
(1) ما هي الأعداد الترتيبية؟

ExampleWords.AUni: first, second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seven, eighth, ninth, tenth, eleventh, twelfth, thirteenth, hundredth, thousandth,

AStr.Run: My parents had five boys and I am the <second>.; This book is the <third> in the series.

Use this domain for numbers that refer to the number of times something happens or is done. These numbers may be adverbs as in English (twice) or in some languages they may be verbs (to do something two times).

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate the number of times something has happened? ("He fell down three times.")
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تدلّ على عدد المرّات التي يحدث فيها شيء ما؟ ("لقد سقط ثلاث مرّات") \qun (2) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما قد حصل في عدد معيّن من المرّات؟

ExampleWords.AUni: once, one time, single time, twice, two times, three times, thrice, four times, many times

AStr.Run: Mary washed the dress <three times>.; I have lent John money <many times>.; I have lent John money <twice>.

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that has happened a particular number of times?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني فعل شيء لعدد معيّن من المرّات (أن تقوم بالشيء مرّة أو مرّتين إلخ..)

ExampleWords.AUni: two-time, three-time,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to doing something a particular number of times (to do something once/twice/etc.)?

ExampleWords.AUni: (none in English)

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to multiples of something (single, double, triple).

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that is two or three times the amount of something else?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما يساوي مرّتين أو ثلاث مرّات كميّة شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: single (portion, scoop), double (adj), triple, quadruple, quintuple, two-fold, three-fold, four-fold,

AStr.Run: The oldest son inherited a <double> portion.

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that something is two or three times the amount of something else?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أنّ شيئا قد أصبح يساوي مرّتين أو ثلاث مرّات شيئا آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: twice as much (as), two times as much (as), two times what, double what,

AStr.Run: He gave you <three times what> he gave me.; He gave you <three times as much as> he gave me.

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to something becoming two or three times as much?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا ما قد تضاعف مرّتين أو ثلاث مرّات؟

ExampleWords.AUni: double (vi), triple, quadruple,

AStr.Run: The size of our herd <doubled> in three years.

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to making something become two or three times as much?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني جعل شيء يصبح مرّتين أو ثلاث مرّات حجمه السابق؟

ExampleWords.AUni: double (vt), triple, treble, quadruple,

AStr.Run: My boss <doubled> my salary.
Use this domain for words related to a group of a particular number of things or people (solo, duo, trio; alone, in threes).

(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مجموعة متكوّنة من عدد معيّن؟

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that only one person does something?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أنّ شخصا واحدا فقط يقوم بشيء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: alone (adv), solo,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to a group of two?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مجموعة متكوّنة من اثنين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: pair, couple, couplet, brace, dichotomy, deuce, dual, dyad, twain, yoke,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to a group of three?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مجموعة متكوّنة من ثلاث؟

ExampleWords.AUni: trilogy, trinity, triple, triumvirate, triune,

Question.AUni: (5) What words indicate that something is done in groups of a certain number?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أنّ شيئا يُعمل بمجموعة متكوّنة من عدد معيّن من الأشخاص؟

ExampleWords.AUni: singly, one by one, two by two, three by three, by ones, by twos, by threes, in pairs, in threes, one at a time, two at a time, three at a time,

Question.AUni: (6) What words indicate that everyone is to get a certain number of something?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أنّ على كلّ شخص أن يأخذ عددا معيّنا من شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: one apiece, two apiece, three apiece, one each, two each, three each,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for the numbers that refer to a fraction of something.

(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني جزء من شيء ما؟

(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني جزءا معيّنا من شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: half, one half, third, one third, two thirds, quarter, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth, ninth, tenth

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to dividing something into a fraction of the whole?

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to something made up of a certain number of parts?

ExampleWords.AUni: duplex, tandem, tripartite,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to counting--to say the numbers in order, or to use numbers to find an amount.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to saying the numbers in order?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أن تَعدّ الأعداد شفويّا و بشكل ترتيبي؟

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to counting the number of something?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أن تحسب عدد شيء ما؟

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to determining the amount of something without being exact?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني تحديد مقدار شيء ما بدون أن تكون دقيقا؟

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to determining the quantity of something a second time?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني تحديد مقدار شيء ما لمرّة ثانية؟

ExampleWords.AUni: miscalculate, miscount, lose count,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the number or amount of something that is counted?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني عدد أو مقدار شيء ما قد وقع عدّه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: calculation, sum, estimate, estimation, count (n),

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to assigning a number to each thing in a series?
(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني إعطاء عدد لكلّ عنصر ينتمي إلى سلسلة أعداد؟

ExampleWords.AUni: number, assign a number, count off

Question.AUni: (8) What words describe an amount that cannot be counted?
(8) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف مبلغا لا يمكن حسابه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: innumerable, unnumbered, uncountable, uncounted, countless,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to mathematics and arithmetic--the study of numbers.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to mathematics?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُشير إلى الرّياضيات؟

ExampleWords.AUni: mathematics, math, arithmetic, geometry, algebra, calculus, trigonometry, statistics,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to determining the amount of something?

ExampleWords.AUni: deep, deeply, deep-seated, in the depths, deep down,

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that is very deep?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما يكون عميقا جدّا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: bottomless,

ExampleWords.AUni: knee-deep, waist-deep, over your head, out of your depth,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to a deep place?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مكانا عميقا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: the depths, channel, trench, gulf, abyss,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to something becoming deep?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا ما يُصبح عميقا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: deepen, get deeper,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to making something deep?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني جعل شيء ما عميقا؟ (7) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أن يكون الشّيء أعمق من شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: deepen, dredge, dig out,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to being deeper than another thing?
(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تُشير إلى مدى عمق شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: deeper, deepest,

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to how deep something is?
(8) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز مدى عمق شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: depth,

Question.AUni: (9) What words indicate how deep something is?
(9) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني قيس مدى عمق شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: how deep, be (ten feet) deep, (ten feet) in depth, at a depth of (ten feet), plunge (ten feet),

Question.AUni: (10) What words refer to measuring how deep something is?
(10) ما هي الأدوات التي تُستعمل لقيس مدى عمق شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: take a sounding, plumb,

Question.AUni: (11) What instruments are used to measure how deep something is?
(11) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني وحدة قيس العمق؟

ExampleWords.AUni: plumb line,

Question.AUni: (12) What words refer to a unit of depth?

ExampleWords.AUni: fathom,

ExampleWords.AUni: shallow, not deep, skin-deep, superficial, surface,

Question.AUni: (14) What words refer to a shallow place?

ExampleWords.AUni: shallows, shoal,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to measuring something--to find out the size, length, weight, or amount of something.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to measuring something?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني قيس شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: measure, take a measurement, assay, assess, balance, calibrate, determine, fathom, gauge, grade, mete, meter, pace, plumb, quantify, rank, reach, read, take a reading, record, rule, sound, span, step off, stretch, stride, survey, tape, test, time,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the size or amount of something?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مقياس أو كميّة شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: capacity, dimension, distance, extent, length, measure, portion, quantity, size, volume,

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe something that can be measured?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما يمكن أن يقاس؟

ExampleWords.AUni: measurable, quantifiable,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the number or amount that you get when you measure something?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني العدد أو الكميّة التي تتحصّل عليها عندما تقيس شيئا ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: measurement, reading,

Question.AUni: (5) What general words refer to a unit of measure?
(5) ما هي الكلمات العامّة التي تعني وحدة قياس؟

ExampleWords.AUni: unit, measure, standard, scale, benchmark,

Question.AUni: (6) What words indicate that something is a particular size or amount?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئا ما يساوي قياسا أو كميّة معيّنة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: is, measure (v), weigh, how big, of

AStr.Run: two kilos <of> sugar

Question.AUni: (7) What instruments are used to measure something?
(7) ما هي الأدوات التي تُستعمل لقيس شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: abacus, almanac, beam, calendar, caliper, chain, chronometer, clock, compass, dial, gauge, instrument, level, line, micrometer, plumb, protractor, quadrant, rod, rule, ruler, sextant, square, straightedge, tape, tapeline, thermometer, watch, yardstick,

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to an amount that cannot be measured?
(8) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني كميّة لا يمكن قيسها؟

ExampleWords.AUni: immeasurable, measureless, incalculable, unfathomable, unmeasured, untold,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to weighing something.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to weighing something?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني القيام بوزن شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: weigh,

AStr.Run: The shopkeeper <weighed> the rice.

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the weight of something?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني وزن شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: weight, mass,

AStr.Run: What is the <weight> of a liter of water?

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to a unit of weight?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني وحدة قيس الوزن؟

ExampleWords.AUni: ounce, pound, ton, milligram, centigram, decigram, gram, dekagram, kilo, kilogram, metric ton, kiloton, megaton, atomic weight, carat, dram, grain, hundredweight, pennyweight, stone, talent, gross weight, net weight,

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate that something is a particular weight?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئا ما عنده وزن معيّن؟

ExampleWords.AUni: is, weigh, how heavy, weigh in at,

AStr.Run: The rice <weighs> one kilo.

Question.AUni: (5) What instruments are used to weigh something?
(5) ما هي الأدوات التي تُستعمل لوزن شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: scale, balance, weight,

AStr.Run: I have a <scale> we can use to weigh the rice.

Question.AUni: (6) What words describe a system of weights?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف نظام قيس وزن؟

ExampleWords.AUni: apothecary, avoirdupois, metric, troy,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to how much weight something can support without breaking or falling?
(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني كميّة الوزن يمكن لشيء أن يتحمّله بدون أن يتكسّر أو يسقط؟

ExampleWords.AUni: support, carry, hold, load, weight, pressure,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing something that is flat--having a surface that is even. A board or wall is flat when its surface is even and it does not bend.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing a horizontal orientation in relation to the ground or something that is level--a flat surface that does not rise in any direction. A person is horizontal when he is sleeping. A field is level when it is not on a hill and it has no uneven areas in it.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something in a horizontal position?

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to becoming horizontal?

ExampleWords.AUni: fall on your face, fall prone, prostrate oneself, get horizontal, fall flat, hit the dirt, lay flat

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to causing something to be horizontal?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني جعل شيء يصبح أفقيّا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: lay something flat, lay something down, align

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe a surface that is level?

ExampleWords.AUni: level (adj), even (adj), flat

(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني جعل شيء مسطّحا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: make level, level (v),

(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا ما ينتمي إلى فئة من الأشياء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be, be a kind of, be a type of, be a member of, include

AStr.Run: An ant <is> an insect.; An ant <is a kind of> insect.; Dogs, cats, and horses <are members of> the animal <class>.; Plants <include> trees, flowers, and weeds.; The animal <class> <includes> dogs, cats, and horses.

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the class to which something belongs?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الفئة التي ينتمي إليها شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: type, kind, class, group, variety,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to a member of a class?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني عضوا من فئة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: kind (of), type (of), member (of), example (of), sort (of), such

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to assigning something to a class?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني نَسب شيء ما إلى فئة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: classify (with, as), classification, class, assign to a class, categorize, grade, group, sort,

AStr.Run: Mushrooms are not <classified with> the plants.; I would not <classify> this fossil <as> a dinosaur.
Use this domain for words related to the nature of character of something.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the nature or character of something?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني طبيعة أو شخصيّة شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: nature, character, such

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to comparing something or someone with another thing.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to comparing one thing with another?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مقارنة شيء ما بآخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: compare, comparison, contrast, than, comparable

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing something that is the same thing as you just mentioned, or describing two things that are exactly the same.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the same person or thing, not a different one?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني نفس الشّخص أو الشّيء، وليس شيئا آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: the same, the very same, the self-same, one and the same, common,

AStr.Run: This is <the same> man that I saw yesterday.; This isn't <the same> man, it's another man.

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe two things that are the same?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئين يكونان نفس الشّيء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: same, identical, indistinguishable, can't tell the difference, can't tell them apart, be no different from, match, be a carbon copy, word for word, be synonymous with, be no better than, be nothing more than,

AStr.Run: This is <the same> as that.; The twins are <the same> in every way.

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that two numbers or amounts are the same?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ عددين أو كميّتين يُمثّلان نفس الشّيء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: the same, equal, equivalent, even, level,

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe someone or something that is the same as before?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شخصا ما أو شيئا ما بقي على حالته كما في السّابق؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be the same, unchanged, hasn't changed a bit, hasn't changed at all, unaffected,

Question.AUni: (5) What words describe someone or something that never changes?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شخصا ما أو شيئا ما لا يتغيّر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: the same, consistent, unchanging, constant,

Question.AUni: (6) What words describe something that is the same in all its parts?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما يكون نفس الشّيء في كلّ أجزائه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: uniform, homogeneous,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to making all the things in a group the same?
(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني جعل الأشياء المنتمية إلى مجموعة نفس الشّيء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: standardize, bring something into line,

Question.AUni: (8) What words indicate that two things that people said are the same?
(8) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئين قالهما النّاس يمثّلان نفس الشّيء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: correspond, be consistent with, agree, tally, coincide, match up,

Question.AUni: (9) What words indicate that something in one group is the same in some way as something in another group?
(9) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئا ما في مجموعة ما هو نفسه الذي يتواجد بطريقة ما في مجموعة أخرى؟

ExampleWords.AUni: corresponding, equivalent, counterpart, opposite number,

Question.AUni: (10) What words refer to thinking the same as someone else?
(10) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني التّفكير بنفس طريقة شخص آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: like-minded, be on the same wavelength, be in tune with, be in harmony,

Question.AUni: (11) What words indicate that a part of one thing is the same as part of something else?
(11) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ جزءا من شيء ما هو نفسه الشيء الذي يتواجد في شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: overlap,

Question.AUni: (12) What words indicate that two things are the same in some way?
(12) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئين هما نفس الشّيء بطريقة ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: equally, of equal, equal in, just as, as...as, every bit as, even, evenly,

Question.AUni: (13) What words refer to saying that two things are the same in some way?
(13) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني القول بأنّ شيئين يُمثّلان نفس الشّيء بطريقة ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: equate,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing two things or people that are similar, but not the same.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe two things that are similar?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئين مماثلين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: like, similar, alike, much the same, comparable, parallel,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to something being like another thing?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا ما يكون مثل شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: resemble, bear a resemblance to, akin to, have an affinity with, the same sort of,

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe two things that are very similar?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئين يتشابهان كثيرا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be two of a kind, have a lot in common, tantamount,

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe two things that are a little similar?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئين يتشابهان قليلا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: kind of like, vaguely resemble

Question.AUni: (5) What words indicate that something happens or is done in a similar way?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئا ما يَحصل أو يُنجز بطريقة متشابهة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: similarly, like, such as, as,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to something being like another thing in some way?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا ما يكون مثل شيء آخر بطريقة ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: have something in common, share something, correspond,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to something looking like another thing?
(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا ما يبدو مثل شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: look like, resemble, the image of,

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to something looking very much like another thing?
(8) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا ما يبدو مشابها جدّا لشيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be just like, look just like, be the image of, be the spitting image of, be the living image of, could pass for, could be mistaken for, be a dead ringer for, be the picture of,

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to someone who looks like another person?
(9) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شخصا يُشبه كثيرا شخصا آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: look-alike, double,

Question.AUni: (10) What words refer to being like your mother or father?
(10) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أنّك تكون مثل أمّك أو أبيك؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be like, take after, be a chip off the old block,

Question.AUni: (11) What words indicate that someone or something makes you think of another person or thing because they are similar?
(11) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شخصا ما أو شيئا ما يجعلك تُفكّر بشخص آخر أو شيء آخر لأنّهما متشابهان؟

ExampleWords.AUni: remind someone of, be reminiscent of, echo,

Question.AUni: (12) What words refer to the quality of being similar?
(12) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني خاصيّة أن يكون الشّيء مماثلا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: similarity, likeness, resemblance,

Question.AUni: (13) What words refer to the way in which two things are similar?
(13) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الطّريقة التي بها يكون شيئان متشابهين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: similarity, parallel,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing two things that are different--not the same.

(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئين مختلفين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: differ, different, else, vary, dissimilar, unlike,

(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني بأنّ عددين أو كميّتين مختلفتين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: difference, variation, dissimilarity,

(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني اكتشاف الاختلاف بين شيئين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: tell the difference, see the difference, distinguish, differentiate,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to other, as in 'the other person', 'another thing'--a thing that is not the same as something that has been mentioned.

ExampleWords.AUni: other, another, different, else, other than,

AStr.Run: This isn't the same man, it's <another> man.; I'm not talking about John, I'm talking about the <other> man.; I'm talking about someone <else>.; It must have been someone <other than> you.

ExampleWords.AUni: strange, odd, funny, peculiar, weird

(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شخصا لا يشبه أغلب النّاس الآخرين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: unusual, abnormal, exceptional, aberrant, peculiar, unnatural, eccentric, uncommon, rare, unique, odd, strange, queer, quaint, original, unconventional, weird

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to not being like most other people?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أن لا يكون الشّخص مثل أغلب النّاس؟

ExampleWords.AUni: unconformity, nonconformity

(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أحسن نمط أو مثال على شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: archetype, epitome, hero, ideal, paragon

ExampleWords.AUni: image

(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مقياس نموذج مقارنة بالشّيء الحقيقي؟

ExampleWords.AUni: scale, full-scale, life-size,

ExampleWords.AUni: imitate, pattern after, mimic, imitate, copy

(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني القيام بنفس الشّيء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: likewise,

ExampleWords.AUni: copy (v), make a copy of, duplicate, photocopy, reduplicate, reproduce, clone, replicate, triplicate,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a copy of something?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني نُسخة من شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: copy (n), duplicate, photocopy, duplication, clone, replica, reproduction,

ExampleWords.AUni: material, composition, stuff, substance,

(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز المادّة التي صُنع منها شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: out of, with, from, of,

AStr.Run: John built his house <out of> cement blocks.; This picture was done <with> oil paints.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing something, such as a tool or way of doing something, that is proper for a particular time, place, purpose, or job. The words in this domain involve a comparison between two things, an item and a setting. An evaluation is made as to how good the item is in the setting. The words may be used only of certain types of items, certain types of settings, or certain types of usefulness.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that is proper?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما يكون مناسبا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: right, proper, applicable, apposite, apropos, becoming, befitting, correspond, correspondent, corresponding, decent, due, expected, felicitous, germane, meet, opportune, pertinent, pleasing, principled, properly, right-minded, rightful, smart, suitable, suited, timely, well, well-timed,

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that is right for a particular job?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما يكون مناسبا لوظيفة ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: right, proper, accepted, approved, appropriate, correct,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to something being right for a particular job?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا ما يكون مناسبا لوظيفة ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: suit, lends itself to, be suited to, be cut out for, be made for, fit the bill, fit in, be right for, be the right person for, make a good/ideal,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to something someone does that is right for a particular situation?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا ما يفعله شخص ما ويكون مناسبا لوضعيّة معيّنة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: right, proper, acceptable, appropriate, apt, correct, fitting, suitable, be the done thing, be the way it's done, in keeping with,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to doing something in the right way?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني فعل شيء ما بطريقة صحيحة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: right, properly, correctly, by the book,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the quality of being proper?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني خاصيّة أن يكون الشّيء مناسبا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: suitability, suitableness, fit (n),

ExampleWords.AUni: nightly, every night, each night,

Question.AUni: (8) What words indicate that something happens during the whole night?
(8) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئا ما يحصل طوال الليلة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: all night long, the whole night long,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to days relative to each other.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to one day in relation to the days before and after it?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني يوما في علاقة باليوم الذي يسبقه واليوم الذي يتلوه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: today, yesterday, the day before yesterday, three days ago, tomorrow, the day after tomorrow, three days from now, the day before, the day after

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to a time of the day.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a time of the day?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني فترة زمنيّة من فترات اليوم؟

ExampleWords.AUni: time, hour, watch,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to dawn?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الفجر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: dawn, sunrise, daybreak, aurora, cockcrow, dawning, sunup,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to the time between dawn and noon?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني فترة زمنيّة بين الفجر ونصف النّهار؟

ExampleWords.AUni: morning, midmorning, am, antemeridian, ante meridiem, forenoon, matins, morn, early morning

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to noon?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني نصف النّهار؟

ExampleWords.AUni: noon, midday, meridian, midpoint, noonday, noontide, noontime,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to the time between noon and sunset?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الفترة الزّمنيّة بين منتصف النّهار والمغيب؟

ExampleWords.AUni: afternoon, mid afternoon, pm, postmeridian, post meridiem,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to sunset?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني المغيب؟

ExampleWords.AUni: sunset, sundown, twilight, dusk, nightfall, it gets dark, gloaming,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to the time between sunset and when you go to sleep?
(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الفترة الزّمنيّة بين المغرب والوقت الذي تنام فيه؟ (8) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الوقت الذي تنام فيه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: evening, early evening, late in the evening, tonight, eventide, vesper, late night,

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to the time when you go to sleep?
(8) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني منتصف اللّيل؟

ExampleWords.AUni: bedtime, time to go to sleep,

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to midnight?
(9) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الوقت بين منتصف اللّيل والفجر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: midnight, the middle of the night, pumpkin hour

Question.AUni: (10) What words refer to the time between midnight and dawn?
(10) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الفترة الزّمنيّة التي تسبق الفجر مباشرة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: late at night, the early hours of the morning (2-4), the small hours, the wee hours of the morning, the first watch, the second watch

Question.AUni: (11) What words refer to the time just before dawn?
(11) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الوقت الذي تستيقظ فيه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: just before dawn, hours before dawn, predawn hours, it gets light, foredawn,

Question.AUni: (12) What words refer to the time when you wake up?

ExampleWords.AUni: time to get up,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to a week.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a week?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أسبوعا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: week, this week, last week, next week, the weeks to come

Question.AUni: (2) What words are used to indicate that something happens every week?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل لتبرز أنّ شيئا ما يحصل كلّ أسبوع؟

ExampleWords.AUni: weekly, every week, each week

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to the days of the week.

Question.AUni: (1) What are the names of the days of the week?
(1) ما هي أسماء أيّام الأسبوع؟

ExampleWords.AUni: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday

Question.AUni: (2) What other terms are used for the days of the week?
(2) ما هي العبارات الأخرى التي تُستعمل بالنّسبة لأيّام الأسبوع؟

ExampleWords.AUni: first day of the week (Sunday), second day of the week (Monday), midweek (Wednesday), Sabbath (Saturday), the Lord's day (Sunday)

Question.AUni: (3) What words are used to refer to all the days of the week together?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل لتُشير إلى كلّ أيّام الأسبوع في آن واحد؟

ExampleWords.AUni: days of the week

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to a month.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a month?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شهرا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: month, this month, last month, next month, the months to come

Question.AUni: (2) What words are used to indicate that something happens every month?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل لتُبرز أنّ شيئا ما يحصل كلّ شهر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: monthly, every month, each month

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to a time during the month?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني وقتا خلال الشّهر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: full moon, half moon, new moon,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to the months of the year.

(1) ما هي أسماء أشهر السّنة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November, December

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to seasons of the year that are related to the time of year, the weather, or times of cultivation.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to a season of the year?
(1) ما هي الكلمات العامّة التي تعني موسما في السّنة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: season

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a season related to the time of year?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني موسما مرتبطا بفترة زمنيّة من السّنة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: winter, spring, summer, autumn, fall, holiday season, Christmas season, new year, midsummer, midyear,

Question.AUni: (3) What words are used for a part of a school year?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل بالنّسبة لجزء من السّنة الدّراسيّة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: term, semester, trimester, quarter, midterm,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to a season related to the weather?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني موسما مرتبطا بالطّقس؟

ExampleWords.AUni: season, rainy season, long rains, short rains, dry season, cold season, hot season

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to a season related to a time of cultivation?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني موسما مرتبطا بوقت زراعة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: planting season, growing season, harvest season, hunger season

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to a year.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a year?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني سنة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: year, this year, last year, next year, the years to come

Question.AUni: (2) What words are used to indicate that something happens every year?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل لتبرز أنّ شيئا ما يحصل كلّ سنة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: yearly, every year, annually, annual

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to an era--a very long period of time.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to an era?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني عصرا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: era, age, epoch, the times, generation, this age, the age to come

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to a special day.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a special day of the year?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أيّاما مميّزة في السّنة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: holiday, vacation

Question.AUni: (2) What words are used for the days when a person works?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل بالنّسبة للأيّام التي يعمل فيها الشّخص؟

ExampleWords.AUni: weekday(s) (Monday through Friday), workday, workweek

Question.AUni: (3) What words are used for the days when a person does not work?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل بالنّسبة للأيّام التي لا يعمل فيها الشّخص؟

ExampleWords.AUni: weekend, day off, Sabbath, day of rest

Name.AUni: يأخذ وقته(ها) \qun (1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني كيف أن الناس يتعاملون مع الوقت؟

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to taking time to do something.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to how people relate to time?

ExampleWords.AUni: take time, spend time, use time, make time, find time

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to a short time.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something happens for a short time?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أنّ شيئا ما يحصل لفترة زمنيّة قصيرة؟ (2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئا ما يحصل على مدى فترة زمنيّة قصيرة جدّا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: take a short time, be for a short time, brief, briefly, briefness

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that something happens for a very short time?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أخذ القليل من الوقت لفعل شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: moment, instant, point in time, instantaneous, instantaneously

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to taking a short time to do something?
(3) ما الذي يقوله النّاس عندما يريدون من شخص أن يقوم بشيء في مدّة زمنيّة قصيرة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be brief, be quick,

Question.AUni: (4) What do people say when they want someone to do something in a short time?

ExampleWords.AUni: be brief, don't take long, get it over with

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to a long time.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something happens for a long time?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئا ما يحصل خلال فترة زمنيّة طويلة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: take a long time, be for a long time, go long, go over the time allotted, take forever, last a long time, went on forever, kept going and going, lengthy, enduring

Question.AUni: (2) What do people say when they want someone to do something for a long time?
(2) ما الذي يقوله النّاس عندما يريدون من شخص أن يقوم بشيء ما خلال فترة زمنيّة طويلة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: take your time, make it last, we want this to last a long time

Name.AUni: إلى الأبد (1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل حتّى تُبرز بأنّ حدثا أو وضعا سيتواصل إلى الأبد؟ (2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل لتصف شيئا ما سيتواصل إلى الأبد؟

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to something happening forever.

Question.AUni: (1) What words are used to indicate that an event or state that will continue forever?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل لتُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما سيتواصل إلى الأبد؟

ExampleWords.AUni: forever, always, ever, eternally, incessantly, unceasingly, forever and ever, in perpetuity, for all eternity, for all time

Question.AUni: (2) What words are used to describe something will continue forever?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل لتُشير إلى الوقت كلّه أو إلى وقت لن ينتهي أبدا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: eternal, infinite, everlasting, constant, perpetual, unending, endless, never-ending, unceasing, ceaseless, incessant, undying, immortal, imperishable, deathless, boundless, indefinite, unlimited, immeasurable, never failing, unfailing, timeless

Question.AUni: (3) What words are used to indicate that something will continue forever?

ExampleWords.AUni: be forever, last forever, go on forever, always be there, never fail/end/die/stop

Question.AUni: (4) What words are used to refer to all time or a time that will never end?

ExampleWords.AUni: eternity, infinity, all times

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to something being temporary.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something will only last for some time and then end?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما سيدوم فقط لفترة زمنيّة معيّنة ثمّ سينتهي؟

ExampleWords.AUni: temporary, transient

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to an indefinite time.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to an indefinite time?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني وقتا غير محدود؟

ExampleWords.AUni: when, then, sometime, someday, anytime, onetime, whenever, approximate, approximately,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to telling time.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to telling time?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الاخبار بالتّوقيت؟

ExampleWords.AUni: tell time, keep time, mark time, measure time, beat time, register the time, to chronicle

Question.AUni: (2) What is a written record of times and events called?
(2) ماذا يُسمّى السّجل المكتوب من الأوقات والأحداث؟

ExampleWords.AUni: chronology, chronicle, record, history

Question.AUni: (3) What is a person called who keeps time?
(3) ماذا نسمّي شخصا يُراقب الوقت؟

ExampleWords.AUni: timekeeper

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate a particular time?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز وقتا معيّنا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: (In written English we use a semicolon to separate the hour from the minute: 5:00.)

AStr.Run: It is now five <o'clock>.; It is five <a.m.>; It is five <p.m.>; It is noon <time>.; ten minutes <after> five.; <half> <past> five.; a <quarter> <to> five.; at ten <of> six.; a <quarter> <of> an hour.; in <half> an hour.; ten minutes <past> <the hour>.
Use this domain for words referring to planning the time of an event.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to planning the time of an event?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني تنظيم توقيت حدث؟

ExampleWords.AUni: plan a time, set a date, schedule something, time something

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the time of an event?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني موعد حدث؟

ExampleWords.AUni: time, date, timing

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to a plan for the time of an event?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني تنظيما لتوقيت حدث؟

ExampleWords.AUni: schedule, timetable, program

Name.AUni: ساعة (1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني آلات للإخبار عن الوقت؟

AStr.Run: Use this domain for machines that indicate what time it is.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to machines for telling time?

ExampleWords.AUni: timepiece, watch, clock, alarm clock, digital watch, analog watch, electric clock, sundial, pendulum, hourglass

AStr.Run: Use the domains in this section for words that relate one time to another. Use this domain for words that indicate a temporal relation between situations.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to one time in relation to another time?
(1) ما هي الكلمات العامّة التي تعني وقتا ما بالنّسبة لوقت آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: relative to, in relation to, before or after

AStr.Run: When did it happen <relative to> his death?

Use this domain for words referring to temporal order or sequence--the order in which a group of events happen. Things and people may also be in order based on the order in which something happened or should happen to them.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the order or sequence of a group of events?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني ترتيب أو تسلسل مجموعة من الأحداث؟

ExampleWords.AUni: order, sequence, cycle, pattern, rota, order of events,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a group of events that happen in order?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مجموعة من الأحداث تحصل في ترتيب؟

ExampleWords.AUni: sequence, series, succession, chain, course, progression,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to a group of things in a series?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مجموعة من الأشياء في مسلسل؟

ExampleWords.AUni: series, lineup, queue,

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe a group of things that have been put in order?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف مجموعة من الأشياء قد وُضعت في ترتيب؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be in order, ordered, in sequence, be the right way round, in chronological order, chronological, consecutive, consecutively, successive, in succession, one after another, one after the other, (three years) running, sequential,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to doing things in order?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني فعل أشياء في ترتيب؟

ExampleWords.AUni: in order, take turns,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the particular order in which something comes?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني نظاما معيّنا يأتي فيه شيء ما ؟

ExampleWords.AUni: place, position, where something comes,

Question.AUni: (7) What words describe a group of things that have not been put in order?
(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف مجموعة من الأشياء لم تُوضع بصفة مرتّبة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: unordered, out of sequence

Question.AUni: (8) What words describe a group of things in the wrong order?
(8) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف مجموعة من الأشياء يكون ترتيبها خاطئا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be out of order, be in the wrong order, be the wrong way round, backwards,

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to something missing from a group of things in order?
(9) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما يَنقُص من مجموعة من الأشياء المرتّبة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: gap

Question.AUni: (10) In English 'Order' can be expressed by a noun phrase with no overt marker.

AStr.Run: the first child; the second taxi; the next person (to speak); the last person (out the door)

Question.AUni: (11) In English 'Order' can be expressed by a 'be' clause with the 'Item' in the subject position.

ExampleWords.AUni: be,

AStr.Run: This child <was> first.

Question.AUni: (12) In English 'Order' can be expressed by a noun phrase with the 'Item' marked by 'of'.

ExampleWords.AUni: of,

AStr.Run: the second <of> the winners
Use this domain for words related to a series--several things that happen one after another.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a series of things, events, numbers or people?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مجموعة مُتسلسلة من الأشياء، الأحداث، الأعداد أو الأشخاص؟

ExampleWords.AUni: series, sequence, string of, succession of, stream, train of events, course of,

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe things in a series?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف أشياء في تسلسل؟

ExampleWords.AUni: successive, consecutive, alternating, serial,

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that someone does things in a series?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شخصا ما يقوم بأشياء في تسلسل؟

ExampleWords.AUni: in succession, one after the other, one after another, straight, in a row, running, alternate

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the place that something has in a series?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تشير إلى المكان الذي يكون عند شيء ما ويكون ذلك المكان متركّبا في تسلسل ؟

ExampleWords.AUni: place, order, rank, slot, grade,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to something happening first--to be before all other things in order or time.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that is first in order or time?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما يكون الأوّل في التّرتيب الزّمني؟

ExampleWords.AUni: first, original, initial, earliest, inaugural, prime,

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate an event or action that is first?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز حدثا أو فعلا يكون الأوّل؟

ExampleWords.AUni: first (adv), first of all, beginning with, starting with,

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that something happened when you first saw something?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئا ما حصل عندما رأيت شيئا لأوّل مرّة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: at first sight, at first glance

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate that something is the first in a list of things that you will talk about?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئا ما يكون الأوّل في قائمة من الأشياء التي ستتكلّم بشأنها؟

ExampleWords.AUni: firstly, first of all, to start with, to begin with, in the first place

Question.AUni: (5) What words indicate that something happens or is done for the first time?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئا ما يحصل أو يُنجز لأوّل مرّة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: first, the first time,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the first time someone does something?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أوّل مرّة يُنجز فيه شخص شيئا ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: debut, premiere, maiden (voyage),

Question.AUni: (7) What words describe something that has never happened before?
(7) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما لم يحصل أبدا من قبل؟

ExampleWords.AUni: unprecedented, a first,

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to doing something that has never been done before?
(8) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني فعل شيء ما لم يُنجز أبدا في السّابق؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be the first to do something, show the way, lead the way, pioneer, break new ground,

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to being the first person to do something in a situation instead of waiting for someone else?

ExampleWords.AUni: make the first move, take the initiative,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to a place that is not near the speaker or the listener?
