AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to being in front of you.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is in front of something else?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما يكون أمام شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: front, in front, in the front, up front, forward, in the foreground, be in front, out in front, before, ahead of,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the front of a line of people or vehicles?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مقدّمة صفِّ من النّاس أو العربات؟

ExampleWords.AUni: the front,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to being at the front of a line?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أن يكون الشّخص في مقدّمة الصّفّ؟

ExampleWords.AUni: at the front, at the head of, leading,

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate that something is in front of you?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئا ما يكون أمامك؟

ExampleWords.AUni: in front, ahead, up ahead,

Question.AUni: (5) What words indicate that two people are in front of each other?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شخصين يكون كلّ منهما أمام الآخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: face to face, facing each other

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating that something is behind you.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is in back of something else?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما يكون في الجزء الخلفي من شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: behind, in back, way back, in the rear, background

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that indicate that something is to the side of someone.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is beside something else?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أنّ شيئا ما يكون حذو شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be beside, alongside, along, next to, at your side, be way over to the side, be on the right, be on the left

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating that something is around something else.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is around something else?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني بأنّ شيئا ما يكون في المنطقة المحيطة بشيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be around, surrounding

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating that something is between two other things.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is between two other things?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني بأنّ شيئا ما يكون بين شيئين آخرين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: between, amid, amidships, amidst, among, amongst, betwixt, center, central, equidistant, half-way, mean, medial, median, medium, mid, middle, middlemost, midst, midway, therein, throughout, within,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating that something is on another thing.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is on something else?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني بأنّ شيئا ما يكون على شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be on, be on top of, topside, upon,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that express the idea that something is above another thing. The concept 'above' is inherently relational, expressing the relative positions of two things.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is above something else?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئا ما يكون فوق شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: above, higher than, over, overhang, up above, super-, supra-, on high,

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that is above something else?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما يكون فوق شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: aloft, overhanging, overhead, upper,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that express the idea that something is under another thing. The concept 'under' is inherently relational, expressing the relative positions of two things.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is under something that is directly above it?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما يكون تحت شيء آخر يكون أعلاه مباشرة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: under, underneath, beneath, under-, sub-

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that something is in a lower position or on a lower level?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما يكون في موضع أقل أو في مستوى أقل؟

ExampleWords.AUni: below, beneath, sunken, lower

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that something is under a covering (such as clothes, skin, or paint)?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما يكون تحت شيء يُغطّيه (مثال: ملابس، بشرة أو طلاء)

ExampleWords.AUni: under, underneath, beneath

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to being under something?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أن يكون الشخص (أو الشيء) تحت شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: underlay, underlie,

Question.AUni: (5) What words describe something that is under another thing?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما يكون تحت شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: underlying, nether,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating that something is outside something else.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is in something else?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني بأنّ شيئا ما يكون داخل شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be in, inside, inner, within

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating that something is outside of another thing.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is outside of something else?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئا ما يكون خارج شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be out, outside, outer

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating that two things are touching or in contact with each other.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to two things touching each other?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئين يلمسان بعضهما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: contact, be in contact, touch, rest against, up against, together, end to end

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to two things moving until they touch each other?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئين يتحرّكان حتّى يلمسان بعضهما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: come into contact, make contact, touch, bump into, come together, brush, skim, graze, meet, connect, butt up against, come to rest against

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe something that is touching another?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما يلمس شيئا آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: abutting, adjoining, contiguous

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating that something is next to something else.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is next to another?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما يكون بجوار شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: next to, right next to, right up next to, by, beside, neighbor, juxtaposed, nearest

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that something is next to something long such as a road?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما يكون بجوار شيء طويل مثل طريق؟

ExampleWords.AUni: along, alongside, by the side of, at the side of

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that something such as a building or country is next to another?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما مثل مبنى أو بلد يكون بجوار مبنى أو بلد آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: next door, adjoin, border (v)

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate that two things are next to each other and facing in the same direction?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئين يكونان قريبين من بعضهما و مواجِهان لنفس الاتجاه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: side by side, abreast

Question.AUni: (5) What words describe something that is next to another?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما يكون مجاورا لشيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: the next, adjacent, adjoining, bordering, neighboring

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that refer to a place on another side of something from the reference point. 'Across' involves three things--the object, the reference point, and something else in between the two.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is across from something else?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما يكون في الاتجاه المقابل مباشرة لشيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: across, across from, on the other side of, on the opposite side of, beyond, offshore from

AStr.Run: The village was on the other side of the river from us.
Use this domain for words indicating that something is at an indefinite location.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to an indefinite location?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني موقع غير مُحدّد؟

ExampleWords.AUni: somewhere, anywhere, someplace, anyplace, where, here, there, over there, any old place, wherever, who knows where, could be anywhere, undisclosed location, location unknown, here and there, whereabouts, hereabouts, thereabouts

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words referring to a direction.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a direction?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني اتّجاها؟

ExampleWords.AUni: direction, orientation, course, way, bearing

AStr.Run: What <way> did he go?; He headed in that <direction>.; Turn to a <bearing> of 270 degrees.

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to facing in some direction?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني أنّ شيئا ما متوجّه نحو اتّجاه ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: face (v), point, orient

AStr.Run: Turn and <face> north.; The temple <faced> east.; We buried him with his feet <pointing> west.; The captain <pointed> the ship into the wind.

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to a person's ability to know what direction he is going in?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني قُدرة شخص ما على معرفة الاتّجاه الذي يتّخذه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: sense of direction

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate that two things are going in the same direction?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئين متّجهان في نفس الاتّجاه؟

ExampleWords.AUni: with

AStr.Run: We were carried down the river <with> the current.

Question.AUni: (5) What words indicate that two things are going in different directions?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئين متّجهان نحو اتّجاهين مختلفين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: against

AStr.Run: The ship was sailing <against> the wind.
Use this domain for words indicating a forward direction.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate the direction forward?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز الاتّجاه أماما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: forward, ahead,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating a backward direction.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate the direction backward?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز الاتّجاه وراء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: back, backward, behind, reverse,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to right and left.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the right side?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني جهة اليمين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: right

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the left side?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني جهة اليسار؟

ExampleWords.AUni: left

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe a person who usually uses his right hand?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شخصا عادة ما يستعمل يده اليمنى؟

ExampleWords.AUni: right-handed

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe a person who usually uses his left hand?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شخصا عادة ما يستعمل يده اليسرى؟

ExampleWords.AUni: left-handed

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to the direction up.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the direction up?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الوجهة إلى فوق؟

ExampleWords.AUni: up, upwards, upward, uphill, upstairs, higher and higher, up and down,

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that is facing or pointing upwards?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما مُتّجها أو متوجّها إلى فوق؟

ExampleWords.AUni: face-up,

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that a path or road goes upward?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ مسارا أو طريقا يتّجه إلى فوق؟

ExampleWords.AUni: go up, climb, rise,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to the direction down.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the direction down?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الوجهة إلى أسفل؟

ExampleWords.AUni: down, downwards, downhill

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating a direction away from something.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is moving away from something else?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تبرز بأنّ شيئا ما يتحرّك بعيدا عن شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: toward, towards, away from, inward, inwards, outward, outwards

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that something moves from one place (to another place)?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما يتحرّك من مكان إلى مكان آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: from,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating a direction toward something.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is moving toward something else?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما يتحرّك باتّجاه شيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: toward, towards, away from, inward, inwards, outward, outwards

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that something moves (from one place) to another place?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما يتحرّك من مكان إلى مكان آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: to,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to the directions of the compass.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to a direction of the compass?
(1) ما هي الكلمات العامّة التي تعني اتّجاها للبوصلة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: direction, heading, point of the compass, degree, bearing, cardinal points

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a direction of the compass?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني اتجاه البوصلة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: north, south, east, west, northeast, northwest, southeast, southwest, northward, southward, eastward, westward, northerly, southerly, westerly, easterly, up north, down south, sunrise, sunset

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe something that is toward one of the directions of the compass?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما يكون في اتّجاه واحد من اتّجاهات البوصلة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: northern, southern, eastern, western, boreal, austral, oriental, occidental, Midwestern, Fareast

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe something going in one of the directions?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شيئا ما متّجه في أحد الاتّجاهات؟

ExampleWords.AUni: northbound, southbound, eastbound, westbound

Question.AUni: (5) What words describe a person who is from a part of the country that is north, south, east, or west?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف شخصا ينتمي إلى منطقة من البلد تكون في الشمال أو الجنوب أو الشرق أو الغرب؟

ExampleWords.AUni: northerner, southerner, easterner, westerner

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to a compass?
(6) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني بوصلة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: compass, needle

Name.AUni: أن يكون الشّخص أو الشّيء في مكان

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to being at a place.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something or someone is in a particular place?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما أو شخصا ما يوجد في مكان معيّن؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be at a place/location, be in a place/location, be located, be situated, be localized, attendance, be present, presence, sit, lie, laid, occupy, be resting

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that something or someone is in the correct or expected place?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما أو شخصا موجود في المكان الصّحيح أو المتوقّع؟

ExampleWords.AUni: in place, in the proper place, in your place, out of place

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to being absent--to not be in a particular place, or not be in the correct or expected place.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something or someone is not in a particular place?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ شيئا ما أو شخصا ما ليس في مكان معيّن؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be absent, not be here, not be around, be out, not be in, be away, missing, be off, not be at, not be there, absence, be gone, not present, be away, nowhere to be found, out of sight, truant, absent without leave, AWOL, missing in action, not show up, make yourself scarce, minus someone, be lacking, lose, elsewhere, somewhere else,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a person who is absent?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شخصا غائبا؟

ExampleWords.AUni: absentee, truant, missing person, no-show,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to an area.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to an area?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني منطقة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: area, region, district, expanse (of land)

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to a vicinity--an area around something else.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the area around something else?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني منطقة تكون محيطة بشيء آخر؟

ExampleWords.AUni: area, vicinity, environs, neighborhood, surroundings, community, district, region, context

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to occupying an area.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to occupying an area?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني احتلال منطقة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: occupy, occupy an area, take up space, cover an area, fill

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to the amount of empty space that is available to be used.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the amount of empty space that is available to be used?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مقدار الفضاء الفارغ والمتاح استغلاله؟

ExampleWords.AUni: space, room, clearance, floor space, elbow room,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to providing space for someone or something?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني تزويد شخص أو شيء بفضاء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: make room, clear a space, make way, get out of the way,

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe a situation where there is just enough room?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تصف وضعيّة يكون فيها الفضاء المتاح كافيا بالضّبط؟

ExampleWords.AUni: a tight squeeze, barely enough room, close fit,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to an interval or space between things.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the area between things?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني الفضاء بين الأشياء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: space, gap, opening, break, interval, separation, hole,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to arranging things with spaces between them?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني تنظيم الأشياء وترك مسافة بينها؟

ExampleWords.AUni: space out,

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that things have spaces between them?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ أشياء يوجد بينها فضاء؟

ExampleWords.AUni: spaced, apart, be spaced out,

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate that things are arranged with regular spaces in between?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ أشياء مُنظّمة بترك فضاء متكرّر بينها؟

ExampleWords.AUni: at regular intervals, every meter, evenly spaced,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that indicate a spatial relation between situations.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that a situation happened at the same place as another situation?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ وضعيّة حصلت في نفس المكان الذي حصلت فيه وضعيّة أخرى؟

ExampleWords.AUni: where, in the same place as, at the same place as

AStr.Run: He is sitting <where> I was sitting.

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that a situation happened at a different place as another situation?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ وضعيّة حصلت في مكان آخر يختلف عن المكان الذي حصلت فيه وضعيّة أخرى؟

ExampleWords.AUni: somewhere else, elsewhere,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that express the idea that something contains something.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something contains something?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني بأنّ شيئا ما يحتوي على شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: have, of, -'s, contain, hold

Question.AUni: (2) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a clause using the verb 'contain' with the 'Container' in the subject position and the 'Content' in the object position.

AStr.Run: The cup <contained> milk.

Question.AUni: (3) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a clause using the verb with the 'Container' in the subject position, the 'Content' in the object position, and the 'Container' in a preposition phrase marked by 'in'.

AStr.Run: The cup <has> milk <in it>.

Question.AUni: (4) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a noun phrase with the 'Container' as the head and the 'Content' marked by 'of'.

AStr.Run: a cup <of> milk

Question.AUni: (5) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a noun phrase with the word 'container' as the head and the 'Content' marked by 'of'.

AStr.Run: the <container> <of> milk

Question.AUni: (6) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a noun phrase with the word 'contents' as the head and the 'Container' marked by 'of'.

AStr.Run: the <contents> <of> the cup

Question.AUni: (7) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a possession phrase with the 'Container' in the first position and the word 'contents' in the second position.

AStr.Run: the cup<'s> <contents>
Use this domain for words that refer to a part of something. These words are often based on the parts of a person's body.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to a part of something?
(1) ما هي الكلمات العامة التي تعني جزءا من شيء ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: part, piece, section, component, portion, bit

Question.AUni: (2) If something has two sides, what words refer to the other side?
(2) ان كان شيء ما يمتلك جهتين، فما هي الكلمات التي تعني الجهة الأخرى؟

ExampleWords.AUni: the back, the reverse, the other side, the flip side,

AStr.Run: Use the following section for words that don't belong in any other domain because they are so general in meaning that you can use them to talk about any topic. Use this domain for general and indefinite words that can be used in the place of any word. Some languages have a general word that can replace a noun or a verb. For instance some Philippine languages use the word 'kwan' in this way. Colloquial German can use the word 'dings' as a noun or verb. Often these words are used when you can't remember the particular word you are trying to think of. In English we use the word 'blank' when we don't want to say a word, for instance when we are testing someone and want them to say the word.

Question.AUni: (1) What words can be used in the place of any word?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل في مكان أيّ كلمة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: blank, ... (ellipsis), you know what I mean

AStr.Run: Many languages have general words that indicate some kind of state. These general words may be used with a wide variety of specific meanings. For instance in English the word 'be' may be used to identify something, describe something, and many other ideas.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to something being something?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا ما يكُون شيئا ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: be, represent, amount to, form, make, constitute

AStr.Run: Your idea <is> good.

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that something is being identified?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز أنّ شيئا ما يقع تحديد هويّته؟

ExampleWords.AUni: is

AStr.Run: John <is> our new leader.; This <is> a pine tree.

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that a group of things is something?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز بأنّ مجموعة من الأشياء تَكوّن شيئا ما؟

ExampleWords.AUni: make up, form, constitute, add up to,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating that something exists.

Question.AUni: (1) What words are used to indicate that something exists?

ExampleWords.AUni: exist, existence, there is, there exists, there lives, be, be found, occur, be in existence, be in operation, real,

AStr.Run: <There is> a man....; <There was> a man....; <There exists> evidence....; Evidence <exists>....; God <exists>.; I think, therefore I <am>.; Once upon a time <there lived> a man....

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to something starting to exist?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا ما يبدأ في التّواجد؟

ExampleWords.AUni: appear, arise, coalesce, come into being, come into existence, come to be, develop, emerge, form, materialize, spring up, take shape

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to continuing to exist?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني مواصلة التّواجد؟

ExampleWords.AUni: remain, persist, persistence, survive, survival, survivor,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to something ceasing to exist?
(4) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني شيئا ما يتوقّف عن التّواجد؟

ExampleWords.AUni: become extinct, extinction, die out, disappear, vanish, cease to exist, disappearance, disintegrate, disintegration, fade, loss,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to not existing?
(5) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني عدم التّواجد؟

ExampleWords.AUni: non-existent, extinct, there's no, there's no such thing,

AStr.Run: Many languages have general words that indicate some kind of change of state. These general words may be used with a wide variety of specific meanings. For instance in English the word 'become' may be used to a change in identity, a change in characteristic, a change in nature, and many other ideas.

Question.AUni: (1) What words are used to indicate a change of state?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تعني تغيُّرا في الحالة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: become (characteristic), change, come to be, turn, get, develop, grow into, turn into, change into, become different, evolve

AStr.Run: John <became> president last year.; The sky <turned> red as the sun set.; After a long illness, John finally <got> better.

Question.AUni: (2) What words are used of causing or producing a state?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُستعمل للتّسبب أو في انتاج حالة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: produce, cause to be, make to be, make, make into, result in, bring upon, bring about

AStr.Run: He <made> me angry.

Question.AUni: (3) What words are used of attaining a state?
(3) ما هي الكلمات الت تُستعمل للوصول إلى حالة؟

ExampleWords.AUni: come to be, attain, achieve, reach

AStr.Run: He <reached> the age of 100.

Many languages have several general words that are used to indicate a variety of relationships between two things. There are three such words in English: "have," "of," and the possessive suffix "-'s." The basic meaning of these words in English is 'to own', but they can mean many other things too. For instance they can mean that I am related to someone (I have a brother), something has a part (birds have wings), and many other ideas. There is also a set of pronouns in English that are like nouns ending in -'s (my/mine, your/yours, his, her/hers, its, our/ours, their/theirs, whose). Use this domain for these general words.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words relate two nouns?
(1) ما هي الكلمات العامّة التي تربط إسمين؟

ExampleWords.AUni: have, of, -'s

AStr.Run: Own: John <has> a house (to sell), the house <of> John, John<'s> house, hi<s> house, who<se> house (is this?), the house is hi<s>; Kinship: John <has> a brother, the brother <of> John, John<'s>brother, hi<s> brother; Relationship: John <has> a friend, the friend <of> John, John<'s> friend, a friend of hi<s>; Member: The school <has> (a hundred) students, the students <of> the school, the school<'s> students; Part: Trees <have> leaves, the leaves <of> the tree, the tree<'s> leaves, it<s> leaves; Name: John <has> three names, the three names <of> John, John<'s> three names, hi<s> names; Know: John <has> the answer, John<'s> answer, hi<s> answer; Hold: John <has> the key (in his pocket), John<'s> key, hi<s> key; Feel: John <has> anger, the anger <of> John, John's anger, hi<s> anger; Sickness: John <has> cancer, John<'s> cancer, hi<s> cancer; Located on: The yard <has> a fence, the yard<'s> fence; Be pictured in: the photo <of> John, John<'s> photo, hi<s> photo; Quality: John <has> status, the status <of> John, John<'s> status, hi<s> status; Use: The secretary <has> a computer, the computer <of> the secretary, the secretary<'s> computer, the computer is her<s>; Event: the arrival <of> John, John<'s> arrival, hi<s> arrival

Attributes often belong to a class of attributes (shape = straight, curved) or to a scale (length = long, short). The class or scale can sometimes be included in the expression, but does not mark the proposition itself. (The towel <feels> damp. The box <weighs> five kilos.)

Question.AUni: (1) What words are used to indicate an attribute of something?
(1) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز صفة تُميّز شيئا ما ؟

ExampleWords.AUni: found to be, discover to be, turn out to be, be in many ways

AStr.Run: <be> characteristic, state; <have> condition; <bear> characteristic; <be in a state of> characteristic; The dirt <is> red.; The towel <is> damp.; This man <is> important.; This man <has> an important status.; The towel<'s> dampness.; The dampness <of> the towel.; The damp state <of> this towel.

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate a point on a scale?
(2) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز درجة على مقياس؟

AStr.Run: The box <weighs> five kilos.

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate an evaluation of something?
(3) ما هي الكلمات التي تُبرز تقييم شيء ما؟

AStr.Run: That woman <is> beautiful.
